pkgmetadata.longdescription: # looseversion - Version numbering for anarchists and software realistsA backwards/forwards-compatible fork of `distutils.version.LooseVersion`,for times when PEP-440 isn't what you need.The goal of this package is to be a drop-in replacement for the original `LooseVersion`.It implements an identical interface and comparison logic to `LooseVersion`.The only major change is that a `looseversion.LooseVersion` is comparable to a`distutils.version.LooseVersion`, which means tools should not need to worry whetherall dependencies that use LooseVersion have migrated.If you are simply comparing versions of Python packages, consider moving to[packaging.version.Version](https://packaging.pypa.io/en/latest/version.html#packaging.version.Version),which follows [PEP-440](https://peps.python.org/pep-0440).`LooseVersion` is better suited to interacting with heterogeneous version schemes thatdo not follow PEP-440.## Installation### From PyPI```pip install looseversion```### From source```git clone https://github.com/effigies/looseversion.gitpip install looseversion/```## Usage```Python>>> from looseversion import LooseVersion>>> LooseVersion("1.0.0") < LooseVersion("2.0.0")True>>> LooseVersion("1.0.0") < "2"True```
